intro: Malvastrum hallii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Malvastrum hallii is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
